messages.title: Dear Resident,
messages.content: Newport Pagnell is a beautiful historic market town. But MK Labour's reckless growth plans would mean we get swallowed up by over-development - Labour would make Newport Pagnell just another suburb of Milton Keynes.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Over £200 million extra investment into Milton Keynes University Hospital. This is both infrastructure and personnel, to ensure everybody receives the best treatment in MK.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Extra Police to Keep Our Streets Safe
keyPolicies.policyDescription: 183 new police officers, and recruitment for Thames Valley, rolling out 60 officers in 9th December, to tackle violent crime so that our streets are safe in Milton Keynes.
From next year we are increasing school funding in Milton Keynes by 6.43%. This is at least £5000 for every pupil here in MK.
Throughout Milton Keynes, there has been over 5000 extra businesses set up in Milton Keynes, including 2255 extra in Milton Keynes North since 2010.
Ensuring hard work is rewarded by an average of £9.30 hourly pay increase in MK and a living wage of £8.21 means hardworking people keep more of the money they earn, so their families and themselves.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protecting Milton Keynes from Labour’s Plans
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposing MK Labour's reckless building if it is planned - but MK Labour will clog our grid roads and strain our public services.

mentions.candidate: Ben Everitt was standing up for Newport Pagnell and bringing a sensible approach to growth in MK.
mentions.tacticalSituation: A vote for any other party could sabotage all our good work in the area.

housing.content: MK Labour's reckless growth plans would mean we get swallowed up by over-development - Labour would make Newport Pagnell just another suburb of Milton Keynes.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am actively fighting MK Labour and Lib Dem plans to build thousands of houses east of the M1.

contactInformation.address: Printed by Peter Guy on behalf of Ben Everitt, both at 5 Quarry Street, Bletchley, Milton Keynes, MK2 2HE.

images.caption: Ben Everitt engaging with the community and discussing local issues and plans.

leaflet.additionalNotes: P.S: There's so much at stake in this election - a vote for Labour or the Lib Dems would risk Corbyn in Number 10. Corbyn's plans would crash our economy and there'd be no money for our public services.
